body: I agree that it makes sens to limit dragging windows using the primary mouse button.

just wanted to ask if this would affect future features like selecting multiple items (maybe in a list view sorta widget) by dragging with primary button, where we can choose secondary button to drag windows or such.
@coderedart if a widget listens for drags (with `Sense::Drag`) then that wins over the window being moved. So when dragging a slider, you don't drag the window.

**Describe the bug**
I am using code inspired by the drag and drop demo, and since updating from egui `0.19.0` to the most recent version, the context menu of the items seems not to work as expected anymore. I re-created this on [egui.rs](https://www.egui.rs/) (accessed 2022-12-17). When right-clicking on `Item B` (see video below, mouse pointer unfortunately not visible in the recording), a context menu with a `Remove` button as per https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/6ae4bc486b2608212f5fc8453f5aa7e5106853f8/crates/egui_demo_lib/src/demo/drag_and_drop.rs#L135 should appear, but instead the `New Item` option appears.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://www.egui.rs/
2. Open the drag and drop demo
3. Right click on any of the items

issue.title: Non-primary/secondary mouse buttons drag-scroll `ScrollArea`s

repository.name: egui
repository.description: egui: an easy-to-use immediate mode GUI in Rust that runs on both web and native

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
My mouse has two extra buttons: page back and forward. I have a music player built with egui that uses these buttons to go to the previous / next track. However, when my cursor is over the `ScrollArea` that contains my music library, these buttons drag-scroll the library, similarly to how primary / secondary click function.

**To Reproduce**
1. Have a mouse with additional mouse buttons. I am using a Logitech G502, but any enthusiast mouse in the last 15 years should suffice.
2. Create a `ScrollArea` that requires scrolling (e.g. expands past the canvas), and has dragging enabled
3. Use the extra mouse buttons. The buttons will drag-scroll the `ScrollArea`.

**Expected behavior**
The extra buttons should not scroll the scroll area. Alternatively, this behaviour should be developer-controllable (e.g. I'd like to restrict drag-scrolling to right-click only for this application.)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 11
 - Version 24H2

**Additional context**
From a cursory inspection, drag-scrolling is controlled by
https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/226bdc4c5bbb2230fb829e01b3fcb0460e741b34/crates/egui/src/containers/scroll_area.rs#L782-L784

which derives its should-drag state from
https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/226bdc4c5bbb2230fb829e01b3fcb0460e741b34/crates/egui/src/context.rs#L1367-L1371

with `potential_drag_id` being set by
https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/226bdc4c5bbb2230fb829e01b3fcb0460e741b34/crates/egui/src/interaction.rs#L162-L186

which does not check for the button in use. A basic fix would be to restrict these two cases to only activate when `button` is the primary or secondary click, but the filter here would ideally be user-controllable. I'm not sure how feasible that would be, as this is decoupled from the widget logic itself.

#578 appears to be related to this; the fix prevented dragging of windows with the secondary button, but the issue seems to cover draggable elements as a whole.
